perturbation.changed_text: Without prejudice to any term and condition under this Agreement, the Company shall maintain in force, at all times during the Term and[*****], at its own costs and expenses, with insurers of internationally recognizedreputation reasonably acceptable to the Repairer, insurances including:(i)Aircraft Hull and Spares All Risks Insurances (including, to the extent usually available war and allied perils); and,(ii)General Third Party Legal Liability and Aircraft Passengers and Third Party Legal Liability Insurance in respect ofincidents involving Aircraft; and,(iii)Employer’s liability insurance.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the terms 'Comprehensive' and the 'Combined Single Limit of not less than [*****] any one occurrence' from the third-party liability insurance clause, the contract fails to ensure adequate coverage as per industry standards. This introduces significant legal risk as it may not comply with Brazilian aviation regulations (if applied).
perturbation.contradicted_law: Brazilian Civil Aviation Regulations (RBAC) - although specific number not cited.

perturbation.original_text: In respect of Hull and Spares All Risk Insurances, the Repairer shall be named as additional insured and loss payee for their respective rightsand interests, to the extent required under Clause 15 (“Liability and Indemnity”) of this Agreement.In respect of Liability Insurance, the Repairer shall be named as additional insured and loss payee, as relevant, to the extent required underClause 15 (“Liability and Indemnity”), with severability of interest and confirmation that the Company policy shall be primary without right ofcontribution.
perturbation.changed_text: In respect of Hull and Spares All Risk Insurances, the Repairer may be named as additional insured. In respect of Liability Insurance, the Repairer may be named as additional insured.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall' to 'may' makes the inclusion of the Repairer as additional insured discretionary, weakening their protection under the insurance policies. This introduces legal risk because it provides less certainty of coverage for the Repairer's liabilities arising from the agreement.
